intro: Banisteria campestris var. ovata, commonly known as the woolly antirrhinum, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptical in shape, with a soft, fuzzy texture. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland areas.
